article.headline: Toledo 73, Buffalo 70
article.story: TOLEDO, Ohio (AP) -- Toledo raced out to a 27-6 lead and held on for a 73-70 win over Buffalo on Tuesday night for the Rockets' first Mid-American Conference win. Justin Ingram had 16 points and led three other Toledo players in double-digit scoring. Toledo (8-4, 1-3 MAC) led 33-16 at the half and was up by 22 points early in the second. But Buffalo (11-3, 1-2) outscored the Rockets 54-40 in the second half, cutting Toledo's lead to 3 with 14 seconds left. Kashif Payne hit three free throws down the stretch to put the game out of reach. He finished with 12 points for the Rockets, who also got 13 points from Florentino Valencia and 11 from Keonta Howell. Roderick Middleton had 22 points and Calvin Cage had 18 for the Bulls. Mario Jordan added 12 points, and Yassin Idbihi scored 11. Toledo outscored Buffalo 21-7 from the bench and held the Bulls to 24 percent shooting in the first half. The Rockets shot 58 percent overall to the Bulls' 43 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
